
{{alias}}( x, n )
    Rounds a numeric value to the nearest multiple of `10^n` toward positive
    infinity.

    When operating on floating-point numbers in bases other than `2`, rounding
    to specified digits can be inexact.

    Parameters
    ----------
    x: double
        Input value.

    n: integer
        Integer power of 10.

    Returns
    -------
    y: double
        Rounded value.

    Examples
    --------
    // Round to 2 decimal places:
    > var v = {{alias}}( {{alias:@stdlib/math/constants/float64-pi}}, -2 )
    3.15

    // If `n = 0`, standard round toward positive infinity behavior:
    > v = {{alias}}( {{alias:@stdlib/math/constants/float64-pi}}, 0 )
    4.0

    // Round to nearest thousand:
    > v = {{alias}}( 12368.0, 3 )
    13000.0


    See Also
    --------
